<script>(function(){
'use strict';
var stats = window.ttiStats = {};
var addListener = function (name, fn) {
if ('addEventListener' in document) {
document.addEventListener(name, fn);
} else {
document.attachEvent('on' + name, fn);
}
};
var removeListener = function (name, fn) {
if ('removeEventListener' in document) {
document.removeEventListener(name, fn);
} else {
document.detachEvent('on' + name, fn);
}
};
var baseTimeStamp = (new Date()).getTime();
var onClick = function onClick() {
stats.click = (new Date()).getTime() - baseTimeStamp;
removeListener('click', onClick);
};
var onScroll = function onScroll() {
stats.scroll = (new Date()).getTime() - baseTimeStamp;
removeListener('scroll', onScroll);
};
addListener('click', onClick);
addListener('scroll', onScroll);
}());
</script>

<div class="local_social_proof_msg__paragraph">
<div data-et-view="IZVEEYdCYEIDdZYHRHVaO:1"></div>
Los Angeles was highly rated for beaches by <strong>5,869 guests from the United States!</strong> <a href="/destinationfinder/cities/us/los-angeles.html">Los Angeles Travel Guide</a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="lp-horizontal-section clearfix">
<div class="lp_flexible_layout_content_wrapper">
<div class="leftwide rilt-left">
<div data-et-view="AEJPCCAURAfPMbATIADDBDOLcPC:1"></div>
</div>
<div class="rilt-fullwidth">
<div id='lp_remove_city_description_track'></div>
<div id="b-city_description">
<h2 class="lp-section-header">City of Angels</h3>
<p>Exploring Los Angeles, the place where movies are made, you feel like you’re in a dream. Santa Monica Pier is the end point of the fabled Route 66, while just south is bohemian Venice Beach, lined by tall, swaying palms. Go slightly inland from the boardwalk to catch a  glimpse of the canals that earned the area its name.</p>
<p>Head north to the golden beach and stunning scenery of Malibu and see why movie stars over the decades have settled here. Also popular with the rich and famous are Bel Air and Beverly Hills, home to exclusive Rodeo Drive.</p>
<p>And the reason for all this glitz and glamour? Hollywood, of course! Sitting high on a hill, the iconic sign is visible for miles around, while below the gold stars on Hollywood Boulevard immortalize celebrities of past and present.  Be there on premiere night to see them grace the red carpet of Grauman’s Chinese Theater.</p>
<p>Over the hill is Universal Studios, with behind-the-scenes tours as well as rides. Next door are the Warner Brothers Studios, and Paramount Studios are closer to Downtown LA.</p>
<p>Whether you decide to live like a star in a luxury LA hotel or choose a cheap motel through Booking.com, it’s worth renting a car to get around this sprawling city and out to Los Angeles Airport (LAX).</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

What Guests Said About Los Angeles:
</h3>
<ul class="destination-reviews toggle-long-text clearfix">

<span class="destination-reviews__country-name">United States of America</span>
</div>

<h4 class="destination-reviews__title">From what I experienced L.</h4>
<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
From what I experienced L.A. is gorgeous. Unfortunately we were only there for a day and we didn't get to visit many of the tourist spots, only downtown and Long Beach. Altho it was as beautiful as I imagined it would have been. 
I plan to return to L.A. to take in all the things that I didn't get a chance to see when I was there.
</p>
</div>

<li class="destination-reviews__item last">
<div class="destination-reviews__user-details">

<h4>George</h4>
<span class="destination-reviews__country-name">United States of America</span>
</div>
<div class="destination-reviews__user-avatar">

>
10
</span>
</span>
<h4 class="destination-reviews__title">Lots to see and do.</h4>
<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
Lots to see and do. Traffic on freeways are horrible. Use non-interstate roads if possible. Food is good though every restaurant is pricey along with motels. Eat at Canter's Deli, Marie Callender's, and Rae's Diner - they are great. Getty Center, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach Beach, and La Brea Tar Pits are must. Both Presidential Libraries are interesting. Uber is cheap.
</p>
</div>

</div>

<h4 class="destination-reviews__title">LA is not what you see on movies!</h4>
<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
LA is not what you see on movies! Local government should take more pride in its streets. There's so much potential. It's a neglected city. Uber is your best friend. Mountain and beach experiences the best. Diversity is the city's treasure snd should be celebrated and rewarded.
</p>

<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
West LA—Santa Monica—Beverly Hills were my stops. I just enjoy the atmosphere! The shopping and people-watching is fun.Guiseppe Franco Salon in Beverly Hills is a special treat if you’re looking for a place to get your hair done—male or female!
</p>

<h4 class="destination-reviews__title">Los angeles is expensive.</h4>
<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
Los angeles is expensive.  It's very hard to live here . Rent is high. Hostels are higher than other cities too. The first hostel I stayed at had bedbugs and is in a very sketchy area, with nothing nearby. So be careful in L.A.. There are a lot of bad people here and also many bad neighborhoods and bad things.
</p>

<h4 class="destination-reviews__title">Santa Monica pier was fun both during daytime and evening.</h4>
<p class="toggle-long-text__content">
Santa Monica pier was fun both during daytime and evening.  Disneyland was perfect, weather was great and no long waiting on rides. Cafe or leans had the best Monte Cristos with a great place to sit, eat, and people watch!

<div id="revc_write_a_review_login_intro" style="display:none;">
<h3>Verified reviews from real guests.</h3><p>We have more than 70 million property reviews, and they're all from <strong>real, verified guests.</strong>
<div class="rlp-intro">
<div class="rlp-intro__container clearfix">
<h3 class="rlp-intro__title">How does it work?</h3>
<ul class="rlp-intro-how">
<li class="rlp-intro-how__item fl">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__container rlp-intro-how__container--tickfull">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__sub-container">
<p class="rlp-intro-how__num rlp-intro-how__num--tickfull">1</p>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__icon bicon-tickfull"></p>
</div>
</div>
<h4 class="rlp-intro-how__title">It starts with a booking</h4>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__desc">The only way to leave a review is to first make a booking. That's how we know our reviews come from real guests who have stayed at the property.</p>
</li>
<li class="rlp-intro-how__arrow fl">
<p class="rlp-intro-how__arrow-icon bicon-rightchevron"></p>
</li>
<li class="rlp-intro-how__item fl">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__container rlp-intro-how__container--citytrip">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__sub-container">
<p class="rlp-intro-how__num rlp-intro-how__num--citytrip">2</p>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__icon bicon-citytrip"></p>
</div>
</div>
<h4 class="rlp-intro-how__title">Followed by a trip</h4>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__desc">When guests stay at the property, they check out how quiet the room is, how friendly the staff is, and more.</p>
</li>
<li class="rlp-intro-how__arrow fl">
<p class="rlp-intro-how__arrow-icon bicon-rightchevron"></p>
</li>
<li class="rlp-intro-how__item fl">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__container rlp-intro-how__container--feedback">
<div class="rlp-intro-how__sub-container">
<p class="rlp-intro-how__num rlp-intro-how__num--feedback">3</p>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__icon bicon-feedback"></p>
</div>
</div>
<h4 class="rlp-intro-how__title">And finally, a review</h4>
<p class="rlp-intro-how__desc">After their trip, guests tell us about their stay. We check for naughty words and verify the authenticity of all guest reviews before adding them to our site.</p>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<p>If you booked through us and want to leave a review, please sign in first.</p>
<div class="intro_footer">
<a href="https://secure.booking.com/reviewtimeline.html" class="revc_write_a_review_login_button">Sign in and leave a review</a>
</div>
</div>

var body = $( document.body );
if (document.getElementById("blockdisplay" + i)) {
for (var j = 1; j <= 4; j++) {

document.getElementById('blockdisplay' + j).style.display = (j === i) ? 'block' : 'none';
}
}

bMovableBookNowButton.init();
}
if (i == 4) {
$(".toggle_overview").show();
$(".toggle_review").hide();
} else {
$(".toggle_review").show();
$(".toggle_overview").hide();
}
}

Hollywood , Los Angeles 7.0 Good 1,846 reviews Description Review All 1,886 properties in Los Angeles Los Angeles was highly rated for beaches by 5,869 guests from the United States! Los Angeles Travel Guide City of Angels Exploring Los Angeles, the place where movies are made, you feel like you’re in a dream. Santa Monica Pier is the end point of the fabled Route 66, while just south is bohemian Venice Beach, lined by tall, swaying palms. Go slightly inland from the boardwalk to catch a glimpse of the canals that earned the area its name. Head north to the golden beach and stunning scenery of Malibu and see why movie stars over the decades have settled here. Also popular with the rich and famous are Bel Air and Beverly Hills, home to exclusive Rodeo Drive. And the reason for all this glitz and glamour? Hollywood, of course! Sitting high on a hill, the iconic sign is visible for miles around, while below the gold stars on Hollywood Boulevard immortalize celebrities of past and present. Be there on premiere night to see them grace the red carpet of Grauman’s Chinese Theater. Over the hill is Universal Studios, with behind-the-scenes tours as well as rides. Next door are the Warner Brothers Studios, and Paramount Studios are closer to Downtown LA. Whether you decide to live like a star in a luxury LA hotel or choose a cheap motel through Booking.com, it’s worth renting a car to get around this sprawling city and out to Los Angeles Airport (LAX). 뉅 뀡 뉅 뉅 덀 녴 덀 녴 Save time, save money! You're done! You can close this window. What Guests Said About Los Angeles: Anonymous United States of America 8.0 From what I experienced L. From what I experienced L.A. is gorgeous. Unfortunately we were only there for a day and we didn't get to visit many of the tourist spots, only downtown and Long Beach. Altho it was as beautiful as I imagined it would have been. I plan to return to L.A. to take in all the things that I didn't get a chance to see when I was there. George United States of America 10 Lots to see and do. Lots to see and do. Traffic on freeways are horrible. Use non-interstate roads if possible. Food is good though every restaurant is pricey along with motels. Eat at Canter's Deli, Marie Callender's, and Rae's Diner - they are great. Getty Center, Hollywood Walk of Fame, Santa Monica Pier, Venice Beach Beach, and La Brea Tar Pits are must. Both Presidential Libraries are interesting. Uber is cheap. Diane United States of America 4.0 LA is not what you see on movies! LA is not what you see on movies! Local government should take more pride in its streets. There's so much potential. It's a neglected city. Uber is your best friend. Mountain and beach experiences the best. Diversity is the city's treasure snd should be celebrated and rewarded. Nancy United States of America 10 West LA—Santa Monica—Beverly Hills were my stops. West LA—Santa Monica—Beverly Hills were my stops. I just enjoy the atmosphere! The shopping and people-watching is fun.Guiseppe Franco Salon in Beverly Hills is a special treat if you’re looking for a place to get your hair done—male or female! Anonymous United States of America 2.0 Los angeles is expensive. Los angeles is expensive. It's very hard to live here . Rent is high. Hostels are higher than other cities too. The first hostel I stayed at had bedbugs and is in a very sketchy area, with nothing nearby. So be careful in L.A.. There are a lot of bad people here and also many bad neighborhoods and bad things. Beverly United States of America 10 Santa Monica pier was fun both during daytime and evening. Santa Monica pier was fun both during daytime and evening. Disneyland was perfect, weather was great and no long waiting on rides. Cafe or leans had the best Monte Cristos with a great place to sit, eat, and people watch! Hotels That Guests Love in Los Angeles Beverly Laurel Motor Hotel “ The medium scale hotel in LA not very nearby downtown but surrounding of the hotels has enough to offer. The personal touch and the level of designed of the hotel made us feel like LA style. We have enjoyed our stay very much. ” Sheraton Grand Los Angeles “ The location is beautifully centered in downtown Los Angeles. The hotel was: clean, very comfortable environment, the staff was awesomely pleasant, kind and very fast to accommodate requests, easy access to restaurant on lower level of restaurant, beautiful deck to relax in, entrance and unlimited complimentary Starbucks coffee in room (made in coffee maker located in room), there was a Walgreens store immediately across from the hotel, as well as other walking distance stores (i.e. Target, Macy's, Rite Aid, etc.). ” The Georgian Hotel “ This hotel was in the best location ever! It's right on the beach and right near shops and entertainment. ” Americas Best Value Inn Los Angeles- 7th Street “ Location is optimum to explore Los Angeles: 5 minutes to downtown and to nearest Metro (7th / Metro), which has connections to several lines and to Union Station (if arriving via AMTRAK)!!! ” Sea Rock Inn - Los Angeles “ Wanted a good price near LA airport (LAX). This was relatively cheap, but well-run. Everything worked, bed was comfortable and clean, parking is in the courtyard area, there is a pool. Don't miss eating at the unique Eatalia restaurant which is very close, and the Burnt Tortilla has good Mexican food. ” Popular Hotels in Los Angeles Millennium Biltmore Los Angeles 4 stars 7.8 Good 987 reviews BLVD Hotel & Suites 4 stars 8.1 Very Good 586 reviews The Hollywood Roosevelt 4 stars 8.2 Very Good 1,809 reviews The Beverly Hills Hotel 5 stars 9.3 Awesome 274 reviews The Standard, Downtown LA 4 stars 7.8 Good 618 reviews Petit Ermitage 4 stars 8.7 Excellent 627 reviews The Garland 4 stars 8.7 Excellent 691 reviews Chateau Marmont 5 stars 8.8 Excellent 304 reviews Viceroy Santa Monica 4 stars 8.4 Very Good 721 reviews Farmer's Daughter Hotel 3 stars 8.7 Excellent 510 reviews The LINE Hotel 4 stars 8.2 Very Good 1,048 reviews Magic Castle Hotel 3 stars 9.1 Awesome 402 reviews The London West Hollywood at Beverly Hills 5 stars 8.7 Excellent 810 reviews Shutters On The Beach 5 stars 8.8 Excellent 457 reviews Ace Hotel Downtown Los Angeles 4 stars 8.3 Very Good 840 reviews You Might Also Like These Hotels Best Western Airport Plaza Inn Renaissance Los Angeles Airport Hotel Crowne Plaza Los Angeles International Airport Homewood Suites By Hilton Los Angeles International Airport Los Angeles Airport Marriott Extended Stay America - We have more than 70 million property reviews, and they're all from real, verified guests. How does it work? 1 It starts with a booking The only way to leave a review is to first make a booking. That's how we know our reviews come from real guests who have stayed at the property. 2 Followed by a trip When guests stay at the property, they check out how quiet the room is, how friendly the staff is, and more. 3 And finally, a review After their trip, guests tell us about their stay. We check for naughty words and verify the authenticity of all guest reviews before adding them to our site. If you booked through us and want to leave a review, please sign in first.
